Hi! I'm an epidemiologist by training, interested in quantifying environment-health interactions. I'm currently a Programmer Analyst at [Weill Cornell Medicine](https://weill.cornell.edu/units/biostatistics-and-epidemiology) in New York City, where my work and research focuses on COVID-19. 

I have a master's degree from Columbia University's Departments of [Epidemiology](https://www.mailman.columbia.edu/academics/departments/epidemiology) and [Biostatistics](https://www.mailman.columbia.edu/academics/departments/biostatistics). I'm also fortunate to have ongoing collaborations with two research groups at Columbia: the National Birth Defects Prevention Study ([NBDPS](https://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/birthdefects/nbdps.html)), and the International Research Institute for Climate and Society ([IRI](https://iri.columbia.edu/)), part of the [Earth Institute](https://www.earth.columbia.edu).
